questions.text: Kevin STMN co created the "Ninja Turtles" in 1984. What is the word that is missing letters?
questions.explanation:
Eastman.

	Kevin Eastman and Peter Laird are the co-creators of the worldwide phenom of the "Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles". The original comic book was turned into several television series, movies, toys and other multimedia items.

questions.text: Wearing a blue mask, LNRD is almost always depicted as the leader of the team.  What is the word that is missing letters?
questions.explanation:
Leonardo.

	Named after Leonardo DaVinci, he is most often depicted with a blue bandana and two katana swords.  The original comic books showed all four turtles in red bandanas, but once they were color coded for the first animated TV series, the blue stuck with him.

questions.text: DNTLL is the most tech-savvy and smartest of the four Ninja Turtles. What is the word that is missing letters?
questions.explanation:
Donatello.

	Donatello Bardi was the namesake for the nerdy ninja in this series. The turtle wears a purple bandana in most incarnations, and is always portrayed as the smartest of the quartet.

questions.text: Most often shown wearing an orange bandana, MCHLNGL is the party dude of the group. What is the word that is missing letters?
questions.explanation:
michelangelo.

	In the comics and some media representations he carries nunchucks, but in other media representations he carries various other weapons as nunchucks are banned in some countries. Mikey is the most outgoing of the group and always tries new toppings on his pizza.

questions.text: RPHL is the most angst-ridden of the four turtles. What is the word that is missing letters?
questions.explanation:
Raphael.

	Named after Raphael Urbino, this turtle is one mad dude. He is very much a loner when compared to his brothers, and oftens charges into a fight without thinking. He carries a pair of ninja sais with him into battle on most occasions.

questions.text: SPLNTR was the ninja master and father figure to the four turtles. What is the word that is missing letters?
questions.explanation:
splinter.

	Sometimes he is depicted as a rat that mutated into a human-like figure. Other times he is depicted as a human who mutated into more of a rat-like figure. No matter the origin, he is always depicted as the sensei who trained the Turtles.

questions.text: SHRDDR is the main villain in most of the incarnations of the Turtles. What is the word that is missing letters?
questions.explanation:
Shredder.

	Despite being killed off in the first issue of the original comic book, Shredder became the most well-known villain the turtles fought. This was mainly due to him being used as the key baddie in the original cartoon which ran on American TV from 1987 to 1996.

questions.text: PRL is the local newscaster and friend to the turtles. What is the word that is missing letters?
questions.explanation:
April.

	April O'Neil is most often depicted as a yellow jumpsuit clad television reporter though in other incarnations she is an antiques dealer and a lab assistant.  No matter her job though, she is always shown to be a friend of the turtles.

questions.text: RCKSTDY is the partner to Bebop and a constant thorn in the side of the turtles. What is the word that is missing letters?
questions.explanation:
rocksteady.

	Bebop and Rocksteady both drew their names from types of music. They were also depicted as mutants, but instead of fighting for good they fought on Shredder's side.

questions.text: The turtles are most often depicted as living in a SWR. What is the word that is missing letters?
questions.explanation:
Sewer.

	In the live-action series "The Next Mutation" and two of the first three live-action movies the turtles are shown to live in an abandoned subway station. In all other iterations though, the turtles are shown to live directly in the sewers.
